gui
Class GraphUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gui.GraphUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GraphUI
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This surface aggregates the data of the simulation in a chart. Since this program is a model of the chemical equilibrium, it is a chart about the concentration of apples(totalApples) over time.

Author:
Daniel Gotzens
See Also:
ApfelGUI, The Wikipedia page about chemical equilibrium, Serialized Form

Class constructor.

Method Detail

initUI

public void initUI()
Sets up the user interface, consisting of the graph itself and its caption.

setSimObjects

public void setSimObjects(Garden[] garden)
Sets the Gardens that this object will collect data about during the simulation

Parameters:
garden - An array of the two Gardens. Used to access their totalApples.

setCurrentMoves

public void setCurrentMoves(int currentMoves)
Sets the current number of steps of the game and also collects data about the "concentration" of apples at this time.

Parameters:
currentMoves - The current number of moves.

setTotalMoves

public void setTotalMoves(int total,
                          int tom,
                          int old)
Sets the total number of moves. Based on that information, an array to store the data of the simulation is created. The first value in this array Ð the number of apples that are in the garden to start with Ð is also set here.

Parameters:
total - The total number of moves.
tom - The amount of apples Thomas initially has in his Garden.
old - The amount of apples the elderly man initially has in his Garden.

setMaxApples

public void setMaxApples(int maxApples)
Sets the maximum amount of apples that can be in the game. Used to determine the scaling of the graph's y-axis.

Parameters:
maxApples - The maximum amount of apples.

drawGraphLine

private void drawGraphLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           int c,
                           int i)
Draws the line of the graph.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics object used to draw.
c - The current player.
i - The position on the x-axis.

updateCurrentPlayer

public void updateCurrentPlayer(int currentPlayer)
Sets the player that currently is to move.

Parameters:
currentPlayer - The current player (duh).
